messages.content: I bought 4 apples, of which I've already eaten one. How many apples does the receipt say I bought?
The receipt should say you bought 4 apples.
I bought all the pears from the market stall. I now have five apples, one of which I've already eaten. How many pears were originally on sale in the market stall?
There is no way to determine how many pears were originally on sale at the market stall based solely on the information provided about the apples.
I bought all the pears from the market stall. I now have five pears, one of which I've already eaten. How many pears were originally on sale in the market stall?
If you bought all the pears from the market stall and now have five pears, one of which you have already eaten, then the total number of pears originally on sale in the market stall was six.
That's not correct. The pear I ate was one of the five I bought.
I apologize for the error in my previous response. If you originally had five pears and you ate one of them, then the total number of pears originally on sale in the market stall was six.
No, I had 5 left of which one of them was eaten. That's different from me saying I had 5 left after eating one.
I apologize for the confusion. If you have five pears left, and one of them has already been eaten, then the total number of pears that were originally on sale in the market stall was six.
